author: soredake
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

Right now there is only a long way to create function:
```
$WshShell = New-Object -comObject WScript.Shell
$Shortcut = $WshShell.CreateShortcut("some.lnk")
$Shortcut.TargetPath = "some.exe"
$Shortcut.Arguments = "enable"
$Shortcut.Save()
```

It will be nice if there a shorter one-line powershell function for creating shortcuts. like `Create-Shortcut -Where C:\link.lnk -Target some.exe -Arguments some-arg`
